title: Using JWST, scientists observe silicate clouds and measure the temperature of exoplanets
summary: With help from the joint NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope, two teams of scientists have made groundbreaking, first-of-their-kind discoveries on two exoplanets. One team utilized the immense power of Webb’s Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI) and Near-Infrared Spectrograph (NIRSpec) instruments to observe and characterize clouds and molecules in the atmosphere of an exoplanet located 40 light-years away.

title: Kleos Space, Spire Global get contract extensions from NRO
summary: Kleos Space and Spire Global have been awarded contract extensions by the National Reconnaissance Office for commercial radio-frequency (RF) data, the companies announced April 3.

title: NASA designa astronautas para su próxima misión de Artemis a la Luna
summary: La NASA y la Agencia Espacial Canadiense (CSA, por sus siglas en inglés) anunciaron a los cuatro astronautas que emprenderán un viaje alrededor de la Luna a bordo de Artemis II.

title: NASA announces crew for Artemis 2 mission
summary: NASA announced April 3 the three Americans and one Canadian who will be on the crew of the Artemis 2 mission, the first humans to travel beyond low Earth orbit in more than half a century.

title: NASA Names Astronauts to Next Moon Mission, First Crew Under Artemis
summary: NASA and the Canadian Space Agency (CSA) announced the four astronauts who will venture around the Moon on Artemis II, the first crewed mission on NASA’s path to establishing a long-term presence at the Moon for science and exploration through Artemis. The agencies revealed the crew members Monday during an event at Ellington Field near NASA’s John

title: NASA unveils the four astronauts who will fly on the Artemis 2 mission around the moon in 2024
summary: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration on Monday announced the four astronauts who will fly on the agency’s upcoming mission around the moon, currently scheduled for late 2024.

title: Redwire to demonstrate a security camera for military satellites
summary: Redwire in a planned demonstration later this year will install ExoAnalytic Solutions' space-tracking software on a navigation camera aboard a satellite in orbit.

title: A passenger aircraft that flies around the world at Mach 9? Sure, why not
summary: “How much does the world change if you can get anywhere in an hour?”

title: Japan delays H2A launch in the wake of H3 failure
summary: Japan has delayed the launch of a H-2A rocket planned for May to no earlier than August in the wake of the failed inaugural flight of H3 rocket.
